Realized gains on investments sold during the period, which, for cash flow reporting, is a component of proceeds from operating activities.
Realized gains on investments sold during the period that are held as an economic hedge for mortgage servicing rights.
Realized losses on investments sold during the period, which, for cash flow reporting, is a component of proceeds from operating activities.

This item represents disclosure of the amount of dividends or other distributions received from unconsolidated subsidiaries, certain corporate joint ventures, and certain noncontrolled corporation in excess of earnings from those investments on a cumulative basis; these investments are accounted for under the equity method of accounting.

The gains and losses included in earnings that represent the difference between the sale price and the carrying value of loans and Leases that were sold during the reporting period and loans held for sale which are still held at period end. This element refers to the gain (loss) and not to the cash proceeds of the sales. This element is a noncash adjustment to net income when calculating net cash generated by operating activities using the indirect method.
Gains or losses recognized on the sale of residential mortgage loans capitalized as mortgage servicing rights.
